statement:
Let $f$ be a primitive polynomial over a commutative unique
factorization domain $R$, say
$$f(x)=a_0 + a_1x + a_2x^2 + \ldots + a_nx^n \;.$$ If $R$ has an
irreducible element $p$ such that $$p\mid a_m \qquad 0\le m\le n-1$$
$$p^2 \nmid a_0$$ $$p \nmid a_n$$ then $f$ is irreducible.

Suppose $$f=(b_0 + \ldots + b_s x^s)(c_0 + \ldots + c_t x^t)$$ where
$s>0$ and $t>0$. Since $a_0 = b_0 c_0$, we know that $p$ divides one but
not both of $b_0$ and $c_0$; suppose $p \mid c_0$. By hypothesis, not
all the $c_m$ are divisible by $p$; let $k$ be the smallest index such
that $p\nmid c_k$. We have
$a_k = b_0 c_k + b_1 c_{k-1} + \ldots + b_k c_0$. We also have
$p\mid a_k$, and $p$ divides every summand except one on the right side,
which yields a contradiction. QED
